result.execSummary:
The defendant Vernon Rose was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory court csots, fees and surcharges through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  To serve 30 days in HOC, consecutive for failure to pay.

Defendant is eligible for Wisconsin Substance Abuse Proram after serving five (5) years from today's date.
Consecutive to: Consecutive with any other senetnce.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.  Defendant to do job searches until he finds a full time job.

No alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No association with victim family Chiquita G, Damien G., Richarge G., Margret B. and Darius W. in person or thru a third party.
No association with known drug users or dealers.  No contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Pay all supervision fees.  To make regular payments.

AODA assessment. Comply with any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Defendant shall be tested twice per month for the first year and then once per month randomly.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence; and advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vernon Rose

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order Denying Request for Sentence Modification received and filed.  Copies mailed to defendant and the State./ds
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Daniel L. Konkol, Br. 44, for review. crt
Defendant's pro se request to modify sentence.
Original Transcript (51 pages) commencing 07-23-2014, SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.
NOTICE OF RIGHT TO SEEK POSTCONVICTION RELIEF / PRETRIAL INCARCERATION CREDIT

Defendant Vernon Rose in court with attorney Craig R. Johnson.  Defendant Vernon Rose in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  11 YEARS, CONSECUTIVE with any other sentence, with credit for   142 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 6 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  The defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, after serving 5 years from today's date,  and IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 

The Court imposed the following conditions of extended supervision:  

- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Defendant shall be tested twice per month for the first year, and then once per month, randomly.
- Seek and maintain full time employment.  Defendant to do job searches until he finds a full time job.
- No association wih Victims Family, Chiquita. G., Damien G., Richard G., Margret B., and Darius W., in person or thru a third party.  
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Defendant to serve 30 days in HOC, consecutive for failure to pay. 
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular payments.


Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon that he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  aw

Defendant Vernon Rose in court with attorney Craig R. Johnson.  Defendant Vernon Rose in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for sentencing.  State requests an adjournment to allow victims to be present.  Court grants request.  Defense is ready to proceed.  Case adjourned for sentencing on 7/23/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Vernon Rose in court with attorney Craig R Johnson.  Defendant Vernon Rose in custody.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for sentencing.  State requests an adjournment to speak with the family of Carolyn G., who was present in court today.  Court grants adjournment.  Case adjourned for sentencing on 7/11/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's sentencing memorandum, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Vernon Rose in court with attorney Craig R Johnson.  Defendant Vernon Rose in custody.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Patricia Daugherty.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered PENALTY ENHANCER dismissed.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 6/9/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Attorney Johnson to bring sentencing memorandum to the court by 6/5/2014 by 12 pm.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Vernon Rose in court with attorney Craig R Johnson.  Defendant Vernon Rose in custody.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests another date.  Defendant may want to resolve the case.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 5/29/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court orders all final pretrial documents filed by the next court date.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Speedy trial demand.
Case set for trial.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 5/19/2014 at 8:30 am, and for jury trial on 6/9/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.   Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  aw

Attorney Craig R. Johnson in court, defendant Vernon Rose not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Court orders bail to remain as stated.  Court is also ordering no alcohol, with random breathalyzers, and to remain absolutely sober.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Notice of motion and motion to modify bail, received and filed.  aw
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Vernon Rose in court with attorney Craig R. Johnson.  Defendant Vernon Rose in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Vernon Rose in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Vernon Rose in custody.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 3.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
